chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant John Michael Sinden Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNT 1: Driver's license revoked for a period of 12 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 1: Ignition Interlock Device installed for a period of 12 MONTHS.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety. 
Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use of prescription medication without a valid prescription. 
No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Pay a $350.00 fine.
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit shall be applied.
If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Michael Sinden Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Michael Sinden Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for John Michael Sinden Jr.  Attorney James C Griffin in court with Intern Kyle Elderkin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State Intern, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statements by: Mary Jackson. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 0 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 10 days in the House of Correction with 0 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 0 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.  
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use of prescription medication without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- AS TO COUNT 1: Driver's license revoked for a period of 12 MONTHS.
- AS TO COUNT 1: Ignition Interlock Device installed for a period of 12 MONTHS. 
- AS TO COUNT 3: Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- Pay a $350.00 fine. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit shall be applied. 

If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Letters

Defendant John Michael Sinden Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for John Michael Sinden Jr. Student intern Kyle Elderkin supervised by Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update to the Court regarding Defendant not being produced. For reason stated on the Court adjourned case for Plea/Sentencing hearing. State will issue an order to produce. Case remains calendared in Branch 2. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in room 635 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant John Michael Sinden not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Due to court congestion, Court orders case adjourned. Defense heard as to bail. State has no objections. Court modifies cash bail to $500.00 and removes Justice Point monitoring and No Contact Order wiht NLJ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant John Michael Sinden not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
CASE SCHEDULED OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John Michael Sinden in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Michael Sinden not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Chernin has been retained.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017227,
Payable Number: 986717,
Receipt Number: 22RP006950,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant John Michael Sinden in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant was planning on retaining private counsel, but has not done so. Court asked the Defendant if he would like SPD to appoint counsel due to him remaining in custoday, defendant stated yes. SPD to appoint. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MLJ.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Michael Sinden in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant John Michael Sinden in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Michael Sinden appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defendant was ordered to appear for all court appearances with or without an attorney.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
